intro: Henriquezia nitida var. nitida, commonly known as the white-flowered henriquezia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, white, five-petaled flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
